alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Randall and eastern Deaf Smith Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Umbarger, or 8 miles west of Canyon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Hereford, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Umbarger and Timbercreek Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
